headline: A Look At Vulcan Materials (VMC) Valuation After Earnings Miss And Softer 2026 Guidance
summary: Vulcan Materials (VMC) is back in focus after its fourth quarter 2025 earnings missed analyst expectations, with lower profits than a year earlier and a more cautious 2026 guidance unsettling some investors. See our latest analysis for Vulcan Materials. The share price reaction to the weaker fourth quarter and softer 2026 guidance has been immediate, with a 1-day share price return of a 0.95% decline and a 7-day share price return of a 6.39% decline. However, a 1-year total shareholder return...

headline: Spotlight on 3 Stocks That Declared Dividend Hikes Amid Market Volatility
summary: VRSK, SHIP and VMC boost dividends amid 2026 market volatility, offering investors steady income as tech turmoil and rate uncertainty rattle Wall Street.

headline: CRH Delivers Strong Construction Outlook. The Stock Is Down.
summary: On Wednesday, CRH reported fourth-quarter earnings per share of $1.52 from sales of $9.4 billion. Wall Street was looking for earnings per share of $1.52 from sales of $9.5 billion.

headline: Truist Securities Maintains Buy on Vulcan Materials, Raises Price Target to $360
summary: Truist Securities  analyst Keith Hughes   maintains Vulcan Materials (NYSE:VMC) with a Buy and raises the price target from $320 to $360.

raw.headline: Truist Securities Maintains Buy on Vulcan Materials, Raises Price Target to $360

headline: 1 S&P 500 Stock with Competitive Advantages and 2 We Turn Down
summary: The S&P 500 (^GSPC) is home to the biggest and most well-known companies in the market, making it a go-to index for investors seeking stability. But not all large-cap stocks are created equal - some are struggling with slowing growth, declining margins, or increased competition.
